intro: Cleistopetalum sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran cleistopetalum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
